Review Text: 10 out of 10. The relaxing stay we needed after 3 days of sailing. Bed was comfortable and we got to enjoy nice view from our room. Smooth check in and check out. Top notch hospitality from all staff, delicious breakfast, even got complimentary foot massage and airport transfer. Great location right in the city center. Truly 5 stars standart service. Would love to come back again!

We stayed at Meruorah Labuan Bajo after three nights of sailing, and it was the perfect place to relax after those rough days at sea. Everything about the hotel felt luxurious and refreshing. Maria was incredibly kind and helpful, she really looked after us and made our stay special. Since it was our honeymoon, the hotel prepared a beautiful room decoration and even surprised us with a complimentary cake, which was such a thoughtful gesture. The room itself was spacious, clean, and beautifully designed, with a stunning view of the ocean. The view from the hotel is absolutely breathtaking, especially during sunset, one of the best we‚Äôve seen in Labuan Bajo. Breakfast was delicious with a wide variety of options, and the overall atmosphere was peaceful and relaxing. The hotel‚Äôs entrance is stunning, giving a great first impression. You can hear some noise from the port, but that‚Äôs part of being in such a central location. The great thing is that the hotel is walkable to many places in town, so it‚Äôs very convenient. We couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better place to unwind after our sailing trip. Highly recommended, especially for couples looking for comfort, great service, and amazing views!

I loved everything about our stay. The rooms very very spacious and comfortable. The view from the balcony was incredible. Breakfast buffet was delicious and catered to everyone‚Äôs taste. The hotel staff was amazing. They played with our 1,5 year son and watching them just filled my heart with love. So cute and kind and from the heart. Thank you so much!

We absolutely loved our honeymoon experience here! The staff were incredible - super helpful and went above and beyond to make our stay unforgettable. They organized the best land and sea tours for us, which made exploring the area so easy and fun. The location and view are amazing, we could walk everywhere and enjoy the stunning surroundings. A special thank you to Ramli, who was incredibly kind, attentive, and always eager to help with anything we needed. 5 stars! Our room was luxurious and had a beautiful view, truly the perfect place to relax and celebrate our honeymoon. Highly recommend Meruorah Hotel for anyone looking for a memorable and romantic stay! üåÖüíñ

Terrific hotel! Service was perfect. Location perfect. Room was very good with amazing views and meals first class. Pool nothing special (well great views but hard to imagine it is used all that much). But the focus is on diving and dragons and the beautiful region and this is the perfect hotel to stay at for those activities. We had a great time.

I had an amazing stay at this hotel! They went far beyond my expectations by providing excellent hospitality from start to finish. The staff were warm, welcoming, and always ready to help with a smile, which made me feel truly at home. The facilities were well-maintained and of great quality, making my stay very comfortable. On top of that, the location is perfect ‚Äî convenient and accessible, with everything I needed close by. Overall, this hotel delivers the best combination of service, comfort, and location. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a memorable stay.

We booked this hotel for 2 nights and actually left after the first night and rebooked our flights and got a hotel for an extra night in our next destination - this hotel was the main reason. Let me start with this - the hotel has amazing location and the view from the lobby is amazing. However, unfortunately there‚Äôs a lot that can be improved with this hotel: - We had booked an airport transfer with the hotel and the car never arrived. The hotel couldn‚Äôt even locate their driver. Reading some of the previous reviews, it seems like a common occurrence. I actually paid for an upgrade to a sea view room from the hill view room but that was probably a big mistake. - We were on the 5th floor right under the pool and we wanted to go to bed early but we couldn‚Äôt because you can hear the pool water splashing in your room until there‚Äôs guests in the pool. - The room has really bad sound proofing. There was a boat with a party in the harbour until midnight and we could clearly hear the lyrics to the songs approximately 800 meters away from the boat. Btw if you‚Äôre on the other side you‚Äôll hear to mosque so there‚Äôs no getting away from this. - We set the temperature to 18 in our room and it never got to that temperature. It stayed around 23. We called front desk, they sent an engineer who fixed it and it started cooling in a bit but in a couple hours went back to the same old. - The staff never even asked us why we‚Äôre leaving early or how the stay was. I generally found the staff to be very unhelpful and not very courteous. Probably the least helpful staff of all hotels I‚Äôve ever stayed at in my lifetime.

Bermalam 3 hari, hotel dekat pelabuhan bajo bisa jalan kaki, kalau hari sedang cerah maka akan beruntung dengan pemandangan sunset yang cantik, service baik. Even if you stay in Labuan Bajo without joining any island-hopping trips, staying here is still enjoyable and relaxing.

We stayed at Meruorah Hotel after a 3-day sailing trip, and it was the perfect choice. The sea-view room was spacious, comfortable, and well-equipped, while the staff were genuinely warm and attentive. The in-house activities made our stay extra special‚Äîafternoon tea, a complimentary foot massage, and sunset yoga (highly recommended!). The spa therapists are truly skilled, and the cocktails were excellent at a great price. The location is ideal‚Äîjust minutes from the harbor and night fish market, with a jogging path nearby. Even the hotel lobby felt refreshing and welcoming. We‚Äôd love to come back for a longer stay! (photo: sea view from my room & the nice walking path)

In the heart of Labuan Bajo. The hotel itself is top notch! From the moment you arrive, the friendly and attentive staff make you feel right at home. The atmosphere is warm, professional, and welcoming‚Äîperfect for both relaxation and adventure. Rooms are modern, clean, and comfortable, many offering stunning views over the harbor. The location couldn't be better, with easy access to the marina, restaurants, and Komodo tour operators. Breakfast is a highlight, with a great variety of local and international dishes. There's something for everyone, including traditional Indonesian options, fresh fruits, pastries, and even jamu (herbal drinks). You‚Äôll leave full and satisfied, ready for a day of exploring. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Labuan Bajo‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs your first time or a return trip!

The hotel is lovely, really appreciate that we were upgraded to a slightly larger room! The location and view of this hotel is very good. Daily buffet breakfast was my favourite, good variety of food and juices. Love the infinity pool and sun beds. Hotel staff very professional and helpful, just as a 5 star hotel should be.

the view was sooo amazing! absolutely loved our experience staying here. the room very spacious and comfy. we can see the amazing scenery from our balcony. also the location of the hotel is very very strategic. their service also excellent, always ready to help.

Very bad service yg aku mention supaya diimprove kedepannya adalah, cara staff mengantar complimentary ke room. Ada satu staff yg ring a bell plus ngetuk pintu berkali-kali seperti tidak sabaran banget. Ini bad experience sih, so far sepengelaman saya nginep di 5 stars itu ya misal ada staff yg ring bell atau ketuk pintu cukup sekali atau max 2xaja, trs nunggu sampe kami membukanya. Laah ini pencet bel berkali2, ketuk pintu pun juga berkali2, such an annoying. Tolong yg staff seperti itu perlu ditraining kembali, biar meet standar pelayanan bintang 5. Selain itu amenities juga standar banget sekelas 5 stars. Terus bekas bedak yg berjatuhan dimeja tidak mereka bersihkan/lap, okelah tidak ditata barang2nya saya tolerir, walaupun hotel 5 stars lain so far nata2 barang2 yg dimeja sampe kadang presisi, tapi ini bekas bedak berserakan pun ga dilap at least.

This hotel is located in a prime location not only by the seaside, but by the main strip as well where all the dive shops are located. I spent about a week here and the service was absolutely phenomenal. The airport shuttle service was great. The room itself was beautiful and clean. The lounge area on the ground floor and the top floor (where the restaurant and the spa are located) provided a very relaxing and beautiful view of the oceanside. The spa itself was amazing - great vibes and top-notch service. I would highly recommend staying here for your next dive trip or if you want to explore Labuan Bajo outside of diving.

We had to wait a bit longer to get into our room, and when we asked, they said it wasn‚Äôt ready yet. Around 10 minutes later, a staff member named Devina came to us, apologized for the delay, and explained there was a laundry issue that day. She asked if it was okay to send the towels around 5 PM‚ÄîI said it was fine, as long as we could just get some rest first. Not long after, she came back with the room key and even walked us to our room. In my opinion, once it hits the official check-in time (3 PM), the hotel should communicate better with guests if there are any issues. But I really appreciate how Devina handled it‚Äîshe followed up with a call to our room and even checked in with us the next morning at breakfast. She wasn‚Äôt just being polite; she genuinely wanted to know how our stay was going and if anything needed improving. Overall, the staff here are very friendly, even if the hotel has a few things to improve. If I ever come back to Labuan Bajo, I‚Äôd still choose to stay at Meruorah because of the warm and thoughtful service.

Great location with spectacular view. Definitely a luxurious experience when you are living here. Hospitality is top notch, the only down side is that they keep the room very bare minimum we had to call to get bath robes, shower and conditioner, iron. Would recommend if you were to visit this beautiful island! Great sunset spot

The lobby & the rooftop pool are the highlights of the property. The room was nice (if strangely designed ‚Äì you can see the toilet from the bed through the all-glass shower stall). Unfortunately, there was a litany of issues: a broken AC that wasn't fixed for over a day (after mentioning it twice) until I had to beg for a new room; extremely slow & incompetent service at the bar (45+ min to get a drink, out of Campari for 3 days but menu not updated / staff not informed); poor maintenance (damaged curtains, horribly shrieking door to the rooftop bar, AC not working); arbitrary rules such as the pool closing at 8PM; a music festival testing their sound equipment right under my room at 6:15AM; the wifi was not initially working in the first room, and was extremely unstable in the second one, and very slow (capped at 5Mbps in both cases); the hotel is right across from the mosque, depending on the room location you'll need earplugs. In the end, despite being twice the price of hotels like Oh!Julia in LBJ, the delivered product was lower quality.

Location is superb! Easy access to the city center. The view in the lobby is amazing. I could stay there forever. The hotel in general seems could be maintained better. While I could see the luxury impression, they did not seem to optimally maintain the hotel. Too many stains spotted in floors. The fragrance used in many public areas smelled rather for a cheap, below standard smell. No hand and face towels were provided. Coffee and tea were below standard for a 5-stars hotel. They had an interesting big billboard to congratulates guests on special occasion, which is a creative entertainment. However, they missed to include our moment despite we had told them prior arrival. Staff were all super friendly.

Our stay at the Hotel Meruorah Komodo was extremely disappointing and does not in any way meet the 5-star standard described. Upon arrival, the air conditioning in our room did not work. After waiting more than an hour, we were moved to another room. However, the new room was also unacceptable: the bed smelled unpleasant, the shower had a strong musty odor, and the room was extremely noisy ‚Äì we could hardly sleep. The food quality was very poor, and we both suffered from nausea the next morning. Neither cleanliness, service, nor overall quality matched the descriptions or photos on the website. The price-performance ratio is completely unreasonable.

We had a wonderful stay! The hospitality was truly great ‚Äî warm and lovely staff. The place is clean and well-maintained. We stayed in an ocean view room and it was peaceful and quiet üåä‚ú® Breakfast doesn‚Äôt have a huge variety, but everything we had was tasty. There‚Äôs so much for kids to do! From swimming and the playroom to the theatre room and even fish feeding ‚Äî our little one was never bored üê†üé¨ Location is super convenient too ‚Äî just walking distance to seafood street, restaurants, ATM, convenience store, and pharmacy. We also had dinner at the hotel ‚Äî the food portions were big and our kiddo said their mashed potato was super yummy ü•îüòã Would definitely stay here again whenever we visit Komodo üíô

I am writing to share feedback regarding my recent stay at your hotel. While I found your staff to be friendly and courteous, I was disappointed by the overall lack of service attention, which significantly impacted the quality of my experience at a five-star property. Some of the issues I encountered included: ‚Ä¢ The airport pick-up transfer was delayed upon arrival, causing inconvenience after a long journey. Staff member recommended to make order your own transport ‚Ä¢ Upon check-in, a dirty plate was left at the front door of my room. Despite several follow-ups, housekeeping failed to address this in a timely manner. ‚Ä¢ The tables in the foyer area were stained, leaving a poor first impression of the hotel‚Äôs upkeep. ‚Ä¢ On the first evening, I ordered cocktails, but the staff forgot to relay the order to the bar, resulting in a long wait. ‚Ä¢ The executive lounge was disappointing, as drinks required additional payment despite being described as complimentary. ‚Ä¢ On the day of my departure, staff forgot to book my transfer back to the airport as requested upon checking in on the first day, creating unnecessary stress. While I truly appreciate the friendliness of your staff, the repeated lapses in service and lack of attention to detail did not meet the standards I expect from a five-star establishment. I hope you take this feedback constructively to improve the guest experience and ensure greater service consistency in the future.

NOT RECOMMENDABLE -EXPENSIVE AND POOR SERVICE - MANY EXTRA CHARGES I arrived with high expectations, but my stay was marked by several serious disappointments. I had booked two rooms for three nights, and we dined in your restaurant on all three evenings. Yet, two out of three days there was no Coca-Cola available‚Äînot in the restaurant, nor in the bar. For a 5-star hotel, this is unacceptable. If supplies run out, replenishing them should be basic service, not a recurring issue. I was also shocked to be charged for beach towel rentals. In every other accommodation I‚Äôve stayed at in Indonesia‚Äîincluding far less expensive ones‚Äîbeach towels were provided without extra cost. For the premium rates your hotel charges, one would expect added value and service, not endless surcharges. At breakfast, the only water available was warm, stored at around 30¬∞C. When I requested a cold bottle, it came with an additional charge. Again, this is not what I expect from a hotel of your category. In the restaurant, service staff seemed more focused on their supervisors than on guests. The pressure on them was evident, and as a result, attention to clients suffered noticeably. Finally, at checkout, I raised these issues and requested that at least the towel rental charge be waived. My request was dismissed coldly, with the explanation that the fee was ‚Äúobligatory.‚Äù This response showed a complete lack of flexibility and client orientation. Overall, I did not experience the level of service a 5-star hotel should provide. Instead, I was left with the impression of a property more concerned with nickel-and-diming guests than delivering genuine hospitality. Sincerely, To resume I will definitely not stay with you during my next stay or recommend your facilities. Beat Regards

A Disappointing Stay at Merourah Hotel: Flooded Rooms, Poor Service, and Missed Expectations in Labuan Bajo Our stay at Merourah Hotel, including the 75 sqm Phiniziy Suite booked for two adults + child 13 year old, and a second room on the 5th floor for a couple friend, was a profoundly disappointing experience that fell far short of even basic hospitality standards. The litany of issues we encountered underscored a complete lack of attention to detail, poor service, and an outdated approach that felt like a relic of indifferent, old-school establishments. The breakfast experience was frustrating from the start. The √† la carte menu was extremely limited, with no option to order individual items. If you wanted something simple like a coffee and eggs, you were out of luck‚Äîguests were forced to select from rigid, overpriced combo meals that lacked flexibility or value. This set a poor tone for the entire stay. The room conditions were even more unacceptable. The second room we booked on the 5th floor for our friends suffered severe flooding, with water pooling up to two inches under the bed, creating an unhygienic and uncomfortable environment. Housekeeping was another disaster. The Phiniziy Suite was not cleaned at all on one day, despite placing the flimsy ‚Äúmake up the room‚Äù sign on the door‚Äîa loose, poorly designed sign that can easily fall off or blow away. On another day, housekeeping took the used towels but failed to replace them with fresh ones, leaving us to chase down staff to resolve this basic necessity. Coming back exhausted and frustrated by the absence of towels was infuriating and unacceptable. The service throughout was lackluster at best. Staff were disengaged, unresponsive, and offered little assistance with our concerns, giving the impression that guest satisfaction was irrelevant. Adding to the frustration, despite paying for three adults in the Phiniziy Suite, the high tea service was only provided for two guests. We didn‚Äôt bother availing of it even once during our three-day stay, as it felt like yet another oversight in an already dismal experience. For the price paid, we were shocked to learn that the 69 sqm Ayana Suite, at a property in a completely different league of luxury and ambiance, was only 10% more expensive. The value at Merourah is simply nonexistent. To make matters worse, the hotel‚Äôs location on a noisy harbor made sleep nearly impossible. Instead of proper noise insulation, like double-glazed windows found in quality hotels, Merourah provides cheap earplugs as a lazy solution. This speaks volumes about their disregard for guest comfort. In summary, Merourah Hotel‚Äôs restrictive dining options, flooding in the 5th-floor room, inconsistent and incomplete housekeeping, indifferent service, inadequate high tea provisions, and poor noise management made for a thoroughly regrettable stay. For the price of the Phiniziy Suite and the additional room, we expected far better‚Äîespecially when a superior option like Ayana is available for a marginal cost difference. I strongly advise travelers to avoid this hotel and choose accommodations that actually prioritize guest satisfaction. P.S. The hotel pool is noticeably smaller than our home pool. This property feels more like a 3-star city hotel than a 5-star experience.

I have to review this hotel because of the quite disappointing experience we had. Unfortunately, even though it is a 5 star hotel, the service lacks completely an adequate level of quality. There is no flexibility whatsoever, here a few examples: when we asked to get a towel to take it to the tour organized by the hotel, the answer was no; or when we confirmed we could use the shuttle on the way back (one day after our last day) as included in our room fare and previously agreed with a receptionist, another one didn‚Äôt allow to do so. In general, the feeling is that the service is insufficient for a 5 star hotel, not accommodating customers‚Äô needs and expectations. Also, the rooms are overall nice, but not a 5 star standard at all. The curtain that can be pulled up or down in the shower, completely ruined at the bottom, the ‚Äúfridge‚Äù which did not cool at all, the spa did not serve any complimentary drink when I went for a foot massage. All small things, but which give an overall feeling of ‚Äúwannabe luxury‚Äù

We had a pleasant stay here and had great service from Irene and Edy (and the other staff that we didn't manage to get names of)! Room was clean and we had a free upgrade to the room with the seaview so we did not have issues noise. The breakfast buffet was quite good. Only qualm was that the staff came in to give us a welcome cake when we were out of the room, without our knowledge, which made us feel a little uncomfortable as our belongings were unpacked. Overall, great location and great stay here!

Go to another hotel if you want to check in before 3pm. Facilities are below 5 stars level, such as no air conditioning in the gym. There is no locker in the shower room. As Erica said, I could put all of my belongings in the reception center before the room was available, however I didn‚Äôt think being naked and going to 6-floor to have a shower was a good idea.

Mencapai kemewahan Meruorah Komodo Labuan Bajo butuh perjuangan indra penciuman. Dari bau pesing di gerbang KP3, langsung check-in ke kamar wangi bintang lima. The smell of success, literally. üëÉ‚ú® Menginap di Meruorah hanya karena reuni dengan kedua Tante, dari US dan Belanda setelah 7 tahun ga jumpa. Transit sebelum mereka cruising kapal Phinisi. Rendezvous actually, just to learn how to be patience and focusing on the good side. But, Di sini, mereka belajar arti sabar: sabar nahan napas pas lewat gerbang KP3 yang bau pesing, dan sabar nahan tawa pas lihat tempat sampah yang isinya tumpah ruah. Luxury life hack Labuan Bajo. üöÆü§£ Labuan Bajo: Surga bahari dengan 'sambutan' gerbang pelabuhan yang bikin hidung perih. Welcome to the real east side, Aunties! üèùÔ∏èüí® They were surprised for the price! Hahaha welcome to Labuan Bajo!

Beautiful hotel in the center of town. Amazing rooms, great breakfast and superb roof top bar and pool. Great stay with easy access into town for bars, restaurants and shopping. Certainly a touch of luxury without the resort prices.

Great breakfast and nice gym and pool. But disappointed about the small plastic bottles of water in the rooms. They could refill glass bottles and provide water refilling station for guests like some of the more modern and big hotels in Bali (they can afford to make this change and be more environmentally friendly). They charged alot for a taxi up the road, more than double the cost of a taxi from other hotels (and same quality vehicle). After paying on the higher end for the accommodation you wouldn‚Äôt expect them to try and rip you off and it‚Äôs disappointing this is their mentality.

A little disappointing‚Ä¶.. Sea View room on level 2 (2263) view partly obstructed by palm trees but still pretty sunset. Very noisy! People walking along the front, music, karaoke and the boats‚Ä¶. Those boats are super loud! Ear plugs solved the problem but be warned about the noise. Two small toilet rolls provided for 2 night stay, ran out on the 3rd morning‚Ä¶ fridge wasn‚Äôt cooling - reception informed me they‚Äôre not meant to cool‚Ä¶. Interesting. Kettle didn‚Äôt work, didn‚Äôt bother asking reception as they would probably tell me kettle not meant to heat. Balcony tiny with two uncomfortable chairs with sweaty plastic cushions and NO table. Pools‚Ä¶. Two, tiny and freezing cold. Nice view from the pools over the harbour but only 8 (yes, EIGHT) sunbeds for the entire hotel‚Ä¶. First in best dressed for those - it seems if you get up early enough they‚Äôre yours for the day, just leave a book and a towel on them and you‚Äôre sorted! Go on a tour for a few hours and they‚Äôll sit empty waiting for you to return. Staff too timid to do anything about it. So if you want to lie by the pool for a day be prepared to get up super early to secure your bed! Also, no umbrellas/shade by the pool so you can burn to your hearts desire!! The gym‚Ä¶. Okay equipment but no towels (just tiny face towels) and no exercise mats‚Ä¶. Poor. As an early riser I had to request the gym be unlocked at 5am for me - staff happily obliged but not sure why it‚Äôs not accessible 24 hours. Breakfast was nice. Overall staff are kind but there were communication issues, for the money we paid it didn‚Äôt represent good value is my feeling. We moved to the Katamaran Resort and are delighted with the hotel and room. Consider the Katamaran - similar price but a world apart in terms of service and amenities.

This hotel is the absolute best. Everyone is so, so lovely and helpful (a special thank you to Irene who truly went above and beyond to give me recommendations during my stay and was so very friendly and helpful). The room was lovely, the front desk was so prompt and professional, and the hotel itself is beautiful. Bonus points for the amazing infinity pool! A+, would definitely return!

This is a nice property located right by the pier, so it is the perfect spot to start or end a liveaboard, but also if staying in LBJ it is a good base to walk the city. The rooms are big and modern. Service is very friendly and attentive, everyone is trying to make sure you're taken care of. Reasons to not give it 5 stars: 1) breakfast buffet was okay, but not quite as good as in other 5-star hotels; 2) WiFi absolutely sucks, which I find unacceptable in a hotel of this caliber; 3) as nice as the rooms were, they were a bit noisy, e.g. I could hear every time the upstairs people moved their furniture. Bonus points: lovely sunset from the pool area

Very nice hotel with great facilities, especially the view from the pool and restaurant is beautiful! We loved the music at the restaurant as well. The location is great, right in the busy area with good restaurants, caf√©s and bars around. All the staff was so helpful and lovely, very attentive and ensured we had everything we needed. Also, the breakfast was amazing!

My wife and I had an unforgettable experience during our recent trip to Labuan Bajo. From the moment we arrived, we were captivated by the stunning panoramic views and the warm, genuine hospitality that greeted us. We checked in just as the sun was setting, and the fiery sky made for a breathtaking welcome. The staff‚Äôs sincere smiles and attentiveness made us feel instantly at home‚Äîand that warmth continued throughout our stay. Every team member we met, whether in the hallways, at breakfast, or at reception, greeted us with kindness and a cheerful attitude. It created such a joyful and welcoming atmosphere. Our room was clean, comfortable, and offered a gorgeous sea view. Waking up to that vista each morning was a highlight. While there was some noise from boats in the nearby harbour, it didn‚Äôt detract from the overall comfort and beauty of the setting. Breakfast was a daily treat! The spread included delicious Indonesian specialties and satisfying Western options. We especially loved the Korean pastries‚Äîsuch a delightful surprise! Standouts for us were the comforting Bubur, Tempe Goreng, and Vegetable fitters Goreng, all cooked to perfection. The breakfast staff were just as lovely, adding warmth to each morning.

Great Hotel with lovely location and view. If I am to visit this place again then I will stay here again. One issue that we complained to the managment and was rectified was the service level in some parts of room service. Otherwisr it is a lovely hotel.

The hotel is not far from the pier (5 minute walk) and there are plenty of excellent restaurants within walking distance. The staffs are extra friendly and attentive although it would be great if the housekeeping replenished my towels without being asked. The rooms are decently sized, bathroom is very clean and modern and the breakfast is okay. One recommendation is booking a car in advance for departure as there is no Grab and the hotel did not provide any assistance with finding a taxi.

Meruorah Hotel is an awesome and delightful place to stay! The location is unbeatable, right by the ocean and just a short walk to the fish market, caf√©s, souvenir shops, and even a mosque. I stayed in a sea view room, which was clean, well-maintained, and super relaxing. The staff and security team were friendly and helpful throughout my stay. A couple of things that could be improved: the check-in process was quite slow, and I noticed a few guests getting visibly frustrated. It might help to have a supervisor or manager present at the front desk during peak hours. Also, small requests like extra towels took a bit longer than expected. Other than that, it was a fantastic experience overall. I‚Äôll definitely be back at Meruorah Hotel next time!

Kami datang untuk menikmati kopi dan snack di lobby hotel yang luas dan nyaman. Kebetulan saat itu ada paket kopi & croissant only 75 rb View nya luar biasa Service ramah, sabar dan sangat membantu. Lokasi di pusat kota , 5- 10menit berjalan kaki dari Marina Dikelilingi cafe, restoran dan Kampung Ujung

Hotel dengan view laut yg supeeeer oke. Pertama masuk lobby sudah langsung dapet view laut jd kita ga bosan saat tunggu waktu check in. Kamarnya bersih, dan sangat nyaman. Dari balkon roomnya kita juga dapat view laut dan bisa nikmati sunset n sunrise yg cantik. Next time kalau ke labuan bajo,so pasti will be back again...recommended banget buat liburan keluarga.

The hotel was very convenient to the airport and marina. This is a great location for one night before embarking on longer trips on a boat in Komodo National Park. The food at the restaurant took a long time to arrive and was not good but it filled the need. Beautiful hotel overall with comfortable rooms.

Meruorah is a great place to stay at Labuan Bajo! Location is fantastic, super accessible to the main road where all the shops and restaurants are. Great views from the pool and lobby and the overall ambiance is relaxing and enjoyable! One downside is that there is a mosque nearby that can disrupt sleep due to the early morning calls to prayers. If you are a light sleeper, that may be a problem. However, Meruorah makes up for it by having amazing service staff! Devina from guest relations is an awesome staff. She is very helpful and friendly and always helped us with a big smile on her face :)) All the guest relation, front office staff were all very helpful and showed genuine care for us! Special mention to Faizal as well! Housekeeping was also fast when we requested for more items. Overall, Meruorah is a wonderful hotel to stay with a great location and great staff! Would definitely recommend to friends and family!

The hotel is within reach to all places you need to reach in LBJ. Masjid , Cruise boat jetty, Fishermen village restaurants, convenient stores, chic cafe all within walking distance (less than 200m). Then within 500m you can reach popular Seaview dining cafes. Has its own worthy Seaview deck. Breakfast was always best time having breakfast with the view. Gym and pool is there. And cake to room every afternoon and movie theatre every night is plus plus for us.

Staff were very helpful, friendly, everything was great! The view here is priceless and expensive. Hotel building is sooo beautiful as well, location is in the city center where you can find most restaurants, shops, atm machines. Breakfast were very yummy too, love their bread so much. We stayed for 3 nights and everything was superb. They offer airport pickup and drop off, but they had fixed schedule, thus we arranged our own transport. However, it is around 10-15 mins drive to the airport so no issue about that. The room can be a bit noisy because it is behind the marina, and when bigger boats came and honk the horn it could be shocking. The hotel prepared earplugs, but we did not use it anyway. One thing that I could say to probably improve the hygiene (maybe not hygiene, but you know some parts of the hotel look not well maintained and old, remembering this hotel is relatively new). The rooms are big and clean thank you. The staff wants to be helpful but their English is poor. Also it is so noisy. Kami memesan kamar the horizon sea view, bisa puas liat pinisi2 berlayar. Dikulkas sdh tersedia berbagai macam softdrink for free. Viewnya mmg best dari sudut manapun we really enjoy the view. The place is honestly amazing. I can't say enough good things about the staff. They are incredibly friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to make you feel welcome and taken care of. I was disappointed by my stay here. We stayed for 4 nights in Meruorah - my partner and I booked a sea view room as well as a village view room for my mom. It was then they revealed that the whole floor was experiencing AC issues so they eventually moved us. The bathroom was really dark. Because we booked two types of rooms, I realized that ONLY TWO LIGHTS in our sea view bathroom was working. One above our sink and one in the shower. Despite having a pool and ocean tours all around them, they didn‚Äôt provide any racks on our balcony to hang up our bathing suits, while also putting signs on our railings prohibiting us from hanging our clothes on them. One afternoon, we sat in the dining area for some drinks. After 15 minutes of waiting, no one came up to take our drinks order so we just gave up. The pool area felt so cramped. Try a night at meruorah for the sunset but then stay elsewhere.

We came to Labuan Bajo for scuba diving. I am very happy with my stay at Meruorah Komodo Labuan Bajo so far. Very comfortable , spacious room. Superb location which is super nearby to the fish market and a lot of eateries, dive centres down the road. The service is superb, very friendly and the housekeeping was efficient. Overall I feel like it‚Äôs value for money to stay here.

Staying here for 2 nights, choose Sea view room and it was incredible, clean room with complimentary minibar. The staffs are nice, friendly. They also providing rent ev motorbike. The food for dinner is good (Martabak especially my husband really like it), but the main course for breakfast was just so so.. and their located next to harbour, so you‚Äôll hear horn sound from the boats, but next to the hotel also you can find so many shops & restaurant/cafe..

Kita bermalam di Meruorah selama semalam, letak hotel ini bersebelahan dengan pelabuhan, dan juga dekat dengan pasar malam makanan, dan juga dekat dengan sentra kuliner lain nya di jalan Soekarni Hatta. This hotel ran out of towels when I asked for an extra - I‚Äôm not sure how that‚Äôs even possible for a hotel. Had a lovely two night stay at the Meruorah hotel, we‚Äôd moved to this hotel as we wanted to be more in town. He was such a lovely gentleman, spoke very good English, and genuinely wanted to talk to us. We were offered a welcome drink, which we excitingly accepted as we hoped it would be a cold beer. Pernah lihat hotel ini di TV saat ada event KTT ASEAN, tidak menyangka kalau sekarang ada di depan mata. Sayangnya saya tidak berkesempatan menginap disana karena alasan budget, akan tetapi saya yakin hotelnya sangat bagus. Semoga suatu saat bisa menginap disana.
Puas banget nginep disini. Staff nya ramah2. Cari makan ngga susah karena banyak tempat makan di dekat hotel. Ngga bingung nyari spot sunset, karena dari hotel udah cukup.

I would probably give the hotel 3.5/5. The positives are spacious rooms, downtown location, great views in the lobby and the restaurant. I have travelled extensively throughout south-east Asia for more than 30 years and this is the worst hotel experience I have ever endured. Disappointing Experience at Meruorah Hotel. The hotel's customer service really fell short for a five star hotel. If you're looking for a nice hotel that would offer peace of mind in case unexpected situations happen, I‚Äôd look elsewhere (keep in mind you're gonna be in a small town with barely any facilities). I had a much better experience with another five star resort that honestly is not way more expensive, not to mention also has a better facilities, restaurants, and view than this (I've been to Labuan Bajo twice before this happened). I was supposed to stay there on Nov 10 2024. Unfortunately, on the day of, my flight was canceled because the Labuan Bajo airport was closed due to a volcanic eruption and it was impossible for me to get there. I called the hotel asking if it's possible to get a refund or any hotel credit for a future stay as this is an unforeseen circumstance due to a natural disaster. In general they seemed unconcerned and unprepared to handle unexpected situations. They just told me they can't do anything and to call the reservation team instead. I tried calling the reservation teams with the number they gave me four times over the course of two hours and no one ever answered. At this point I decided to try again later as it was a Sunday, so I thought maybe their office was closed. I tried calling again the next day and still no answer. Finally, I emailed the hotel on Tuesday, explaining everything and recapping my attempt to contact them. Again, they were very unsympathetic and not helpful. They told me because they were not informed before the check-in date that I was no longer coming, I was marked as a no-show in the system and they were not able to do anything for me. To that: 1) There was no way for me to know the airport was gonna be closed. 2) I had called the hotel on the day of to inform them that the airport was closed (which they already should have been aware, to be honest) 3) I tried to call their reservations team five times with no luck. For comparison, the liveaboard operator and the other resort I had planned for this trip both offered to rebook me for next year. It's ironic because my reservation for Meruorah was supposed to be refundable up until a certain date, while both the liveaboard and the other resort were non-refundable and non-changeable, but they were still much more understanding of the situation and accommodating. Even the hotel I ended up booking in Bali for that night upgraded me to a better room after they heard about what had happened. Now if you really don't care about customer service and you're 100% sure nothing unexpected is going to happen during your trip, the property itself is not bad. My first stay there was alright as nothing unexpected happened which is also why I thought I would stay there one more time before my liveaboard trip. However, as I mentioned before, I've stayed at two different properties before in Labuan Bajo. Meruroah is a nice hotel but nothing to write home about. It has a nice view especially during sunset but so do most other hotels in Labuan Bajo. Some will even have better views as Meruorah is located at sea level while some other ones are located higher. I'd probably give them four stars if it's not because of this entire experience but I can't recommend them anymore after what happened. Side note: I'm not entirely sure why, I emailed them in English and for some reason they responded to me in Indonesian. Fortunately, I do speak Indonesian fluently, but I was surprised when I got the response. Just a heads up for those who might not speak Indonesian.

Don't come here. The facilities in the room are all bad. Only a small part of the shower can come out with water and take a shower. They don't have any explanation or compensation. Don't come here. Can‚Äôt believe it costs more than 100 USD and offers so bad experience. Apr 23- Apr 24 Room 2007

Pool is very small for such a big place and has only 6 sun beds Some things that we liked in this misery and the reasons why I give 2* instead of 1*: Nice view from the lobby and from the rooftop, also comfortable beds and clean room.

My stay at Meruorah was absolutely fantastic. Everything from the location and views to the service, room, facilities, and breakfast spread was top-notch. We used the laundry service, and our clothes were returned in less than 24 hours, crisp and clean, which was impressive given that we had just come back from several days of muddy and wet hiking in the mountains. While flying my drone from the hotel lobby's outdoor area to capture the beautiful sunset over the sea, I lost the signal and assumed it had fallen into the water. I was quite upset. Perfect experience with a big personal touch. We first embarked a boat the night before. Which due to sickness had to be cancelled. We came last minute to the hotel with a request for a room. The personal touch, the food, the comfortable room, and the view was well worth the money. Debby and the rest of the staff, thank you!

Situated at the start of town, it is just next to the fish market and 5 mins walk to the harbour. Hotel has a nice view and rooms are spacious and clean. A pity our nature view room which was on the 2nd floor was facing some strange wall and object. Please also note that the mosque is nearby and you will hear the early morning prayers. The hotel does provide ear plugs though. A good place to stay for a night if you want to be near town.

First of all, this hotel has a splendid view to the marina bay of Labuan Bajo. I suggest to book earlier a room with s view to the sea-side. If not that lucky, then you can still enjoy the view from the restaurant area at the first floor as well as the lounge and open air space at the top level. The hotel itself is quite well maintained, the service is acceptable and the overall experience is alright. The rooms are well furnished, clean and sanitized. The food and beverages are pretty default. The buffer dinner maybe a bit different in menu. However, I must warn you that not all picturesque and instagramable photos of this hotel may be in reality. There are still lacks in the sense of creating a five-star experience.

Unfort this was not what we expected with a 5 star hotel. Our stay started with our full view room being a tree not able to see anything else. A fridge that was required for medicine (insulin) did not work and had to be left in their kitchen. Stains on couch. A daily clean was not satisfactory with rubbish items not collected for disposal. Hot water in shower did not work until service came to fix. Management were of little assistance. I had originally booked a room at the Eco Tree 'Otel downtown, but found it so incredibly loud that I left without unpacking my bags, which was a first. I really needed a good night's sleep. The Meruorah was located on the edge of town and further away from busy roads, so I booked a room online. Arriving it became apparent that their systems are antiquated, as the front desk was unable to verify my online payment, which later became an issue. Asking for a quiet room, they recommended an upgrade to one facing the ocean, which also became an issue as I discovered that the early morning fishing boats made more noise than anything on the street. And regardless of room type, the super loud, piercing Muslim prayers from a nearby mosque could be heard everywhere. Thankfully I had silicone earplugs. That said, the room was clean, well-appointed, and the bed comfy, and I got the rest I needed prior to heading out on a liveaboard the next day. Shower was a warm trickle but did the job. All in all hotel doesn't feel very well cared for, is nowhere near its five star rating, and making money seemed more the focus. Taxi rides to the airport arranged by the hotel were inflated to 250k from a typical 75k, and laundry cost 40k per item when a nearby business (Anya) did all 15 of my items for the same price. The 250k breakfast buffet cost was way more than anything local. Would not likely repeat.

This is a beautiful hotel with STUNNING views of Flores. It's right on the water and the hotel lobby is one of the most beautiful I've seen. Half of the rooms face the ocean and the other half face the city, but my recommendation is to see if they can have you face the ocean. The location is at the center of town and it's walkable pretty much everywhere or a quick grab anywhere. The rooms were amazing, though the gym left something to be desired. That said it was still a lovely resort. Now, the only gripe I and a couple of guess had were some things were not as communicated as hoped. For instance, I request a taxi to the airport at 10:30 the day prior; however, the next day they lost my reservation and had to have the hotel driver drop me off. A Pleasant Stay at Meruorah Hotel in Labuan Bajo, with One Small Hiccup During my recent trip to Labuan Bajo, I had the pleasure of staying at the Meruorah Hotel, which offered a memorable and enjoyable experience, albeit with one minor concern. The hotel's excellent service, beautiful location, and range of amenities made it a wonderful choice for my vacation, but the size of the room left a bit to be desired. The Meruorah Hotel's location is undoubtedly one of its most significant advantages. Situated in close proximity to the bustling harbor and offering stunning views of the surrounding seascape, the hotel provided a serene and picturesque setting. Watching the sunsets from the hotel's vantage point was a highlight of my stay. Upon arrival, I was greeted warmly by the friendly and accommodating staff, who ensured a smooth check-in process. Throughout my stay, their attentive service and willingness to assist with any requests were commendable. The hotel's common areas were tastefully decorated, exuding a charming and relaxing ambiance. The outdoor pool area was a delightful spot to unwind after a day of exploring the beautiful sights of Labuan Bajo. Additionally, the on-site restaurant offered a diverse menu featuring delicious local cuisine, satisfying my taste buds with every meal. Unfortunately, the one aspect that fell short of expectations was the size of the room. While it was clean and well-maintained, the limited space felt slightly cramped, especially when traveling with luggage. The room lacked ample storage, making it a bit challenging to keep things organized during my stay. Despite the room's size, the bed was comfortable, and the essential amenities were provided. However, I believe that a larger room or more efficient utilization of the available space would greatly enhance the overall guest experience. In conclusion, the Meruorah Hotel in Labuan Bajo offers an otherwise exceptional stay. Its prime location, attentive staff, and delightful facilities make it an ideal choice for travelers seeking comfort and relaxation. However, if the hotel could address the issue of room size, it would undoubtedly elevate the overall guest experience. Regardless, I would still recommend this hotel to fellow travelers, but advise them to consider their space requirements when booking their stay.

The hotel didn't communicate the booking to the driver properly, so we found out from the hotel that we'd have to pay 50% extra on the day. This made a terrible stay even worse. It seems like this hotel is very poorly managed and very poorly maintained. It's a shame, the hotels in Bali were a fraction of the price but were brand new, were far better maintained and provided a better level of service. The difference is like night and day. Lastly, I choose to pay the hotel for a shuttle from the airport to the hotel on arrival - there is no Uber or equivalent and was willing to pay up a little for the convenience. I expected a hotel vehicle, what I received was a regular taxi, the hotel charged me 225k IRP and paid the taxi driver 50k - they made 450% profit - that's an outrageous profit margin. On the return trip I arranged my own taxi and paid 50K. Arranging your own taxi on arrival should be easy - there are lots, but you will need cash.
